name: Microsoft
description: The GRC team assisted Microsoft’s Singapore office by providing an organizational strategy framework for its employee benefits programs.

name: Google
description: GRC worked with Google’s offices in APAC and India, advising them on fair hiring practices in the region and strategies to make office spaces more accessible to employees with disabilities.

name: Johnson & Johnson
description: GRC suggested several strategies to J&J to reduce burnout and the mental health stigma for healthcare workers.

name: IKEA
description: The GRC team consulted for IKEA.

name: CJ Foods
description: Over the course of 2 semesters, GRC created single-use plastic waste mitigation strategies in food and beverage packaging and provided CJ Foods with sustainable, eco-friendly delivery solutions for parcels delivered across South Korea.

name: Pepsi
description: GRC advised Pepsi on how to best implement sustainability partnerships with farmers and small businesses in Latin America.

name: Coca-Cola
description: The GRC team consulted for Coca-Cola.

name: UNESCO
description: Compiling a database of youth-led and youth-driven organizations across the Asia-Pacific region in the area of socio-emotional learning.

name: The World Bank
description: Researching the role of the private sector in response to public health emergencies, possible areas of contribution, and comparative advantages. Based on this analysis, GRC created specific recommendations for NGOs and governments to best leverage private sector resources.

name: Wikipedia
description: Assisted the non-profit on the possible launch of a new product, by analyzing the market, possible partners, and possible business models.
